item.title: Borderlands 4 for Switch 2 development paused
item.content:encoded:
• Switch 2

"We made the difficult decision to pause development."

Development on the Switch 2 version of Borderlands 4 has paused, Take-Two Interactive Software said during its Q3 2026 earnings results.

While the Switch 2 version was previously planned to launch on October 3, 2025—slightly after the PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC versions’ September 12 release—it was delayed to an unannounced date the last minute.

“We made the difficult decision to pause development on that SKU,” Take-Two spokesperson Alan Lewis told Variety. “Our focus continues to be delivering quality post-launch content for players on the ongoing improvements to optimize the game. We’re continuing to collaborate closely with our friends at Nintendo. We have PGA Tour 2K25 coming out and WWE 2K26 [for Switch 2], and we’re incredibly excited about bringing more of our titles to that platform in the future.”

item.title: Grand Theft Auto VI marketing to begin this summer
item.content:encoded:
Marketing for Grand Theft Auto VI will begin this summer, Take-Two Interactive Software confirmed during its Q3 2026 earnings results.

In a press release sent to IGN, Take-Two Interactive Software said, “Our execution throughout fiscal 2026 has been extraordinary and we are highly confident as we approach fiscal 2027—which promises to be groundbreaking for Take-Two and the entire entertainment industry—led by the November 19 release of Grand Theft Auto VI with Rockstar’s launch marketing set to begin this summer.”

Asked by IGN how he felt about Grand Theft Auto VI making its planned release date this time, Take-Two Interactive Software CEO Strauss Zelnick said, “I feel good about it. Very good about it.”

Zelnick also told Variety that online rumors about a delayed physical release of Grand Theft Auto VI are false. “That’s not the plan,” he said.

Grand Theft Auto VI is due out for PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series on November 19.
